fields.Chapter Title: Towards a Pedagogical Hermeneutics: A Response to the Manifesto for a Post-Critical Pedagogy.
fields.Description/Abstract: I wish to elaborate on what I see as the two pivotal affirmations in Hodgson, Vlieghe and Zamojski five principles for a “Post-Critical Pedagogy.”: An affirmation of a “pedagogical hermeneutics” and of a passionate hope in and for the world. I discuss the ontological, existential roots of these principles, referencing the existentialist hermeneutics of Heidegger and Gadamer, and an account of pedagogical hermeneutics from Helmut Danner. I begin, however, with a 1983 “modern classic” in pedagogy, Forgotten Connections: On Culture and Upbringing (translated in 2014 by the author of this response) written by Klaus Mollenhauer, whose ideas, I believe, are closely linked if not indispensable to those of the manifesto.
